page.title: 04Farming.
page.content: The farms of the high flat land(see introduction)are mainly mixed farms with cereals,mostly barley but with some wheat,and grassland for cutting and pasture.Different crops,oilseed rape and broad beans,were noted in two fields only.Sheep were numerous in some places but cattle seemed to predominate overall.There are several specialist producers in the area -amoung them being a rabbit farm and a pheasantry. The latter produces eggs, day old chicks and poults-and they are sold throughout Britain and abroad.The birds lay between May and July.In summer about 15 are employed-falling to around 6 in the winter. The steep valley sides are timbered and the valley bottoms only suitable for pasture- but where they widen some of the more gentle slopes are also given over to cereals.
